unnormalised: Delhi residents are fuming over the latest BSES Yamuna electricity bill, with many reporting unexpectedly high charges. Ms. Sharma from Laxmi Nagar complained on Twitter that her bill jumped from Rs. 2500 last month to Rs. 6800 this month, despite no significant change in consumption. Similar complaints are flooding social media, with residents questioning the meter readings and tariff calculations. One user, @KumarRajesh, posted a screenshot of his bill showing a consumption of 550 units for the billing cycle.

unnormalised: Adding fuel to the fire, a recent report by the Delhi Electricity Regulatory Commission (DERC) revealed that billing complaints have risen by 15% compared to last year. The DERC chairman stated that they are taking the complaints seriously and will conduct an audit of the billing process. Consumers are urged to conserve energy and switch to energy-efficient appliances to reduce their bills, but many feel that the underlying problem lies with the accuracy of the billing system itself and are awaiting a resolution.
